==Versions==
==Versions==
â
Since 2007, Mandriva is released on a 6-month fixed-release cycle, similar to [[Ubuntu]] and [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]]. The first release of the year is known simply by the year of release, while the second release of the year is known as ''Spring'' in order to distinguish it from the previous release of the year.{{Fact|date=May 2008}} However, while newer features are added per release, the core internals{{Clarifyme|date=May 2008}} of the Spring release are the same as the first release, so as to ensure the stability of a yearly release.<ref>{{citeweb|title=New release cycle announced|url=http://club.mandriva.com/xwiki/bin/view/Main/NewReleaseCycle|accessdate=2008-04-22}}</ref>
+
Since 2007, Mandriva is released on a 6-month fixed-release cycle, similar to [[Ubuntu]] and [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]]. The first release of the year is known simply by the year of release, while the second release of the year is known as ''Spring'' in order to distinguish it from the previous release of the year.{{Fact|date=May 2008}} However, while newer features are added per release, the core internals{{Clarifyme|date=May 2008}} of the Spring release are the same as the first release, so as to ensure the stability of a yearly release.<ref>{{citeweb|title=New release cycle announced|url=http://club.mandriva.com/xwiki/bin/view/Main/NewReleaseCycle|accessdate=2008-04-22}}</ref>
